snippet: A state order prevents teachers and principals from disclosing the contents of three days of standardized English tests given in April, though 37 principals have sounded the alarm about the design and quality of the tests.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column; New York State order prevents teachers and principals from disclosing the contents of three days of standardized English tests given in April, though 37 principals from schools in Manhattan, as well as others from Brooklyn, have sounded the alarm about the design and quality of the tests.
lead_paragraph: A state order prevents teachers and principals from disclosing the contents of three days of standardized English tests given in April, though 37 principals have sounded the alarm about the design and quality of the tests.

headline.main: A Conversation About Tests That Educators Want to Have, but Can’t
headline.print_headline: A Conversation About Tests That Educators Want to Have, but Can’t
